intro: Chrysopsis mollis, commonly known as the slender goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow, daisy-like flowers and hairy, succulent stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Chrysopsis mollis is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
